results.title: Rubbish. A Puppet pudding
results.creator_credit: Michael Balson, Michael Creighton and Marionette Theatre of Australia
results.brief_description: Rubbish; A non-narrated fantasy adventure about the world of puppets created by a young boy from the odds and ends he collects in the streets. The adventure begins in the long alleys and narrow laneways of the city and culminates in a secret magic place known only to the young boy and his friend the kettlebird. Starring Emil Minty. “A Puppet pudding”; An introduction to the world of Norman Lindsay’s classic Australian children’s story “The Magic Pudding”, using puppets from the Marionette Theatre of Australia’s stage production. Explores the background to the writing of the story and looks behind the scenes of Australia’s national puppet theatre. Concludes with characters on stage at the Sydney Opera House. Presented by Richard Bradshaw.

results.title: Rubbery figures: the world's greatest treasurer
results.creator_credit: Leigh Tilson, Peter Nicholson, Cynthia Mann and Rubbery Figures Productions
results.brief_description: A compilation of rubbery figures skits that first featured regularly in the Australian television comic series of the late 1980’s “Fast forward”. An irreverent and satirical play on the then Australian Prime Minister and treasurer (and comic duo it seems), Bob Hawke and Paul Keating. Includes skits Evil Kneating, Back to the Future and more. Puppeteers: Esther Haskell, Jenny Ishmakovich, Jenny Sherlock and Kath Gordon.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leigh Tilson, Peter Nicholson, Cynthia Mann and Rubbery Figures Productions

results.title: Royal river [Abridged version]
results.creator_credit: Gordon Sparling, Roger Blais, Grant McLean and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The picturesque St. Lawrence, Canada’s river of history, welcomes Queen Elizabeth II to the opening of the St. Lawrence Seaway. Many close-ups of the Queen, Prince Philip and President Eisenhower are shown. The theme of the film is the river’s history, from its discovery by French explorers to its opening to the shipping of the world. This is an abridged version.

results.title: Roustabout
results.creator_credit: John Rich, Hal B. Wallis and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: The year is 1964, and the mini-skirt is in. Charlie Rogers is a coffee-house singer who joins a financially troubled carnival. He is hired by owner, Maggie Morgan, and soon catches the eye of his pretty female co-worker, Cathy Lean. Cathy’s irate father, Joe, clashes with Charlie when he tries to romance his daughter, but Charlie’s singing and looks helps bring in the much-needed money for the near-bankrupt carnival. Cast includes Elvis Presley, Barbara Stanwyck, Joan Freeman and Leif Erickson.
